#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Lodwar
#Text=Lodwar is the capital of the Turkana District in the Northern Rift Valley region of Kenya .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Flights are available from Wilson Airport in Nairobi .
#Text=Charter aircraft can be hired in advance for drop-off and pick-up at the landing strip near center of town .
#Text=Fly-540 operates daily flights from Jomo Kenyatta Airport .
#Text=You can book online or at the airport .
#Text=Lodwar only has an airstrip , no airport .
#Text=By train
#Text=There is no train service at Lodwar .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Nairobi to Kitale ( which is the transit point to Lodwar ) is about 6 to 8 hours and the road conditions are not bad .
#Text=From Kitale to Lodwar , most of the tarmac roads have either been swept awayby seasonal river or have deteroriated due to neglect .
#Text=Do n't drive to Lodwar unless you have a landcruiser or something close to that .
#Text=After Kapenguria ( a small town ) there are very few villages and if your​ car breaks down you will have to wait for days .
#Text=You 'd better use a bus or a flight .
#Text=Most of the road from Kitale to Lodwar are now ( Feb 2018 ) in pretty good shape after recent repairs .
#Text=It 's only the last 80 km or so that are still mostly washed out .
#Text=There are no service stations or rest areas once you enter Turkana district at the south until you reach Lodwar .
#Text=Not recommended to travel by night , and beware of bandits .
#Text=The road to Lokichokio is in excellent condition ( which is interesting , since roads south are very poor ) .
#Text=This road is in reasonable condition because of the number of NGOs in Loki .
#Text=Lokichokio was the base for the aid and relief effort for Sudan and Ethiopia .
#Text=Near Loki is also a refugee camp .
#Text=Do not travel to Loki unless you have a good reason or if you are part of a NGO .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are several bus services from Nairobi to Lodwar but the main ones ( and probably safer ) are ;
#Text=Dayah Bus - From Nairobi ( Eastleigh ) to Lodwar directly charges- Ksh 2100 .
#Text=You can also connect two buses .
#Text=One from Nairobi to Kitale at Ksh 1000 depending on the bus and another one from Kitale to Lodwar at Ksh 1000 .
#Text=Do n't bother to ask when the bus is leaving , you will be told very soon .
#Text=It leaves when the bus is full .
#Text=So you 'd rather use a small matatu plying the route if you are n't patient .
#Text=By boat
#Text=There is boat service at L. Turkana , Kalokol ( 50 km from town ) for travels to Sibiloi Game Reserve .
#Text=Contact Jade Sea Travels for boat hire .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Matatu ( minibus ) in city Ksh 50 .
#Text=Hired taxi available for small fee .
#Text=Travel by the local bus-taxis ( Matatus ) if you 've got the guts for it -they 're mini-buses that they shove full of people ( literally ) .
#Text=They 're cheap ( ask someone at the hotel what the going rate is ) do n't let them scam you .
#Text=They are all over and in huge numbers , and they 're licensed ( stickers on the windshields ) .
#Text=Taxis do n't have taxi-signs on the roof , but license papers stuck to the windshields .
#Text=See
#Text=Basket market daily .
#Text=Do
#Text=Browse the basket market in town .
#Text=Turkana district is known for intricately woven baskets ranging in size from minute to 100L ( 25 gallon ) size .
#Text=Women at the market hawk wares such as brooms , baskets , makekas ( woven sleeping mats ) , beads , and tire sandals .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Equity Bank .
#Text=Has a Mastercard/Visa Card ATM .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Natural salted fried fish is in plenty , also ensure you taste a meal locally called federation not forgetting the delicious nyirnyir
#Text=eliye springs resort , eliye ( 50 km of lodwar ) .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Tusker beer
#Text=Chibuku ( Not for the faint at heart . )
#Text=Sleep

#Text=There is a private developer in progress of setting up several state of the art commercial offices , massionates with swimming pool in the Nawoitorong-kerio road , which will be offering business offices and accommodation to diplomats , high ranking officials , tourists and NGOs staff who visit Lodwar and are willing to spend night in town while enjoying the lighting view of the whole town from a distance and it will be a gated community .
#Text=Budget
#Text=St Teresa Pastoral Centre has great rooms in a lush green setting run by Catholic sisters for Ksh 2500 .
#Text=They also have a very productive produce garden in the back of the compound fed by a borehole which is a bit of a novelty for the area .
#Text=Nawoitorong Lodge has clean rooms starting at Ksh 800 per night .
#Text=It 's also called the Womans Lodge by the locals .
#Text=It located in the outskirts of town , a Ksh 50-100 piki ride from the center .
#Text=Very friendly staff and quite area .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Do n't walk the streets at night , as this will invite unwanted attention .
#Text=It is best to hire a guide if you intend to do any exploring within the city .
#Text=This city is not really a tourist mecca , and thus , does not have any real tourist infrastructure .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Lawrence Wangs , +254720761424 , is a very reliable and punctual source for transport in the Lodwar area and beyond .
#Text=He takes up to 7 people at a time for Ksh 10000 a day plus fuel ( Feb 2018 ) .
#Text=He has a lot of local knowledge and can take you all over the Turkana District in air conditioned comfort .
